comment: Dr. Rama is fantastic. He does his best to explain the lab prior to starting it, and he is happy to answer any questions you have before/during the lab. He likes students who show interest in the subject and make an effort in the lab. I felt very prepared for the final exam. Take Dr. Rama, you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took his lab during covid restrictions and he did his best to make it easier on the students. He has a strong accent, but once you get used to it it is easy to overlook. His lectures before the labs can get a little confusing, but he gives most of the answers. Grades pretty easy and is an overall great guy.

In this class, I learned very little, as his lectures are vague and the assignments are convoluted. I got an A in this course through learning it all for myself. The final exam is standardized and his lectures do not prepare you for it. He won't really help you understand the material, since if you ask for help he just does it for you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The final exam is standardized, and his lectures will NOT prepare you. I managed to get an A in Chem 1212 Lecture. However, I received a B in the Lab. His lectures are long and disordered. The lab reports always took WAY long then they should have because his lectures are so confusing. As a hard-working student, please, choose someone else.

Dr. Rama is a really funny guy. He over explains everything, which drags on the lectures, but it's smooth sailing once he finishes lecturing and the lab begins. If you pay attention and do your work, you will do fine in the class.
Does all of the lab work for you and is an easy grader, wouldn't recommend taking him for lecture though.

If you want to pass you have to teach yourself, and even then you might not because the homework is often nothing like the tests, and the final is standardized. He doesn't know how to use myChemLab so the due dates changed a lot, he gets behind on the material, and yells at you for leaving if he's not done talking even if it's past time to go.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Soft spoken, caring and good teacher. Wants his students to succeed . He has an accent, but he tries hard  to be clear. His notes, solution to problems and questions & answers are posted on D2L. Likeable.

One word, terrible. I couldn't understand half of what he said and he couldn't solve the problems he put up on the board. He cannot use a computer well and won't upload grades. I had no idea what my grade was the entire semester. He randomly changes due dates for homework without telling the class. Avoid him at all costs, you'll thank me later.

Has a pretty think accent so you can't understand him. Take someone else beware.  He goes off on a tangent and his test are harder than diamonds. Great guy but awful teacher. The class average for our 2nd test was a 57 not to mention he doesn't curve. PLEASE TAKE SOMEONE ELSE! 120 people started the class and only 40 people are left.

If you're looking for clarity, look elsewhere. He'll confuse the whole class and keep going.  He assumes that if one person answers correctly then the whole class understands it. Lots of online hw and most of the assignments he gives out are harder versions of hw. Writes extremely small on the board, so if you want to see I suggest sitting up close
